en: The border facility feels different today. Tense. Security patrols in greater numbers as wary silence replaces chatter.
Last night, [pulse freq=2][color=CRIMSON]prohibited materials[/color][/pulse] were discovered. Pamphlets containing lies about [color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color].
We're implementing [wave amp=15 freq=2][color=DARK_ORANGE]threat level ORANGE protocols[/color][/wave]. All officers subject to loyalty screenings. All travelers face maximum scrutiny.
It's working. The pamphlets are spreading. People are asking questions about [color=DARK_VIOLET]Root Reserve[/color].
I have sources telling me there's a shipment log in Russet's office - transport manifests that could [tornado radius=3 freq=2][color=CHARTREUSE]prove everything[/color][/tornado].
I need you to help me get it. Tonight, after final shift. Can I count on you?
"I don't know, Sasha...this could be dangerous."
Thank goodness. I knew you had [color=CHARTREUSE]stronger roots than the others[/color]. We'll meet at midnight.
Sometimes we have to [color=CHARTREUSE]risk getting mashed to do what's right[/color]. Think about it.
[color=DARK_ORANGE]Loyalty check[/color]. Please state your name and officer ID. Then tell me why you serve Spud.
"I serve to protect our borders from dangerous influences."
"I serve to ensure everyone receives fair treatment."
Good answer. Spud needs loyal protectors. Scanner reads green. Carry on, officer.
The officer's eyebrows raise. Fair treatment? Scanner flashes [color=DARK_ORANGE]amber[/color]. Remember, our primary concern is security, not fairness.
Today's quota has been increased. Anyone with suspicious materials is to be flagged for [color=DARK_VIOLET]special processing[/color].
I'll be [color=DARK_ORANGE]watching your decisions[/color] very carefully today.
Tonight could change everything. But first, [color=YELLOW]survive the day without raising suspicion[/color].
